questions.text: The episode opened with Kara drained of her powers.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Carrying over from the end of the previous episode, Kara had somehow been drained of her powers. During this episode she was as vulnerable as a human for most of it. For the first time in her life she caught a cold, got a paper cut and had no use of her powers. James Olsen told her that the same thing happened to Superman from time to time after he overused his powers.

questions.text: What happened to Kara during the earthquake?
options: She wasn't able to help anyone because her boss was with her.
She failed to save her sister.
She was stuck in an elevator.
questions.explanation:
She broke her arm.

	Being powerless, when the earthquake hit Kara was able to be injured like anyone else. She broke her left arm and had to wear it in a sling for about half of the episode. Despite her injury and lack of powers, she attempted to help people still as both Supergirl and as Kara.

questions.text: What was the name of the escaped alien prisoner?
questions.explanation:
Jem.

	Jem had several powers that made him a formidable foe, including his ability to overcome mind control and camouflage.  Jem was able to best several government agents, Alex Danvers, and Kara at times during the episode.

questions.text: How many DEO agents were killed by the villain of the week?
questions.explanation:
2.

	Two Department of Extra-Normal Operations officers were killed by Jem while they were hunting him alongside director Hank Henshaw. Henshaw, who was actually the Martian Manhunter in disguise, was able to survive the attacks.

questions.text: Maxwell Lord, hinted as the season long "Big Bad", had training as a medical doctor.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The billionaire inventor and business man revealed that he had went to medical school after college while assisting the injured after the earthquake. He said it only took him one year to become a doctor.

questions.text: Who anchored the live broadcast from the CatCo World Headquarters after the earthquake?
questions.explanation:
Cat Grant.

	Cat told everyone in the office that the people needed them more than ever during the fiasco. The staff rushed to set up generators and got ready to go live. Cat took the first broadcast herself.

questions.text: James Olsen revealed that the first photo he ever took was of what subject?
options: Lois Lane falling off a carnival ride
questions.explanation:
His father.

	James' first photo was of his father after he received a camera as a gift. Olsen had been close with his father, before he was killed in combat in the Gulf War. Olsen later won a Pulitzer Prize for a photo of Superman he took while working at "The Daily Planet".

questions.text: Who ended up beating the villain of the week?
questions.explanation:
Hank Henshaw.

	Hank was the only one with the capabilities to best Jem during this episode. With Kara still powerless, he had to step up and use his own hidden abilities. He still wasn't willing to reveal his secret to more than Alex and Kara.

questions.text: Who was the first person Supergirl saved with her powers in the episode?
questions.explanation:
James.

	Near the end of the episode her powers finally returned.  Just in the nick of time Supergirl was forced to fly to James' rescue as he was falling off of a building.

questions.text: After revealing his identity as the Martian Manhunter, what name did Hank reveal was his "real" name?
questions.explanation:
J'onn J'onzz.

	Henshaw had been a real human and the actual director of the DEO when he first encountered the Martian Manhunter. After an attack, and the death of the real Hank Henshaw, Jeremiah Danvers asked J'onn J'onzz to protect his two daughters as they went through life.
